summary: This bill, the Small Business Transportation Investment Act of 2025, establishes a pilot program allowing small businesses providing ground transportation services to purchase vehicles through the General Services Administration's (GSA) federal supply schedules. It aims to increase efficiency, reduce costs, and promote environmentally friendly vehicles. Participating businesses must use the vehicles for at least two years and donate a portion to local nonprofits. The Administrator of General Services is required to submit annual and final reports to Congress evaluating the program. The pilot program is set to expire after three years.
